verses.verse: The song <S%H7892><s%> of songs, <S%H7892><s%> which <S%H834><s%> is Solomon's. <S%H8010><s%>
Let him kiss <S%H5401><s%> me with the kisses <S%H5390><s%> of his mouth: <S%H6310><s%> for your love <S%H1730><s%> is better <S%H2896><s%> than wine. <S%H3196><s%>

Because of the smell <S%H7381><s%> of your good <S%H2896><s%> ointments <S%H8081><s%> your name <S%H8034><s%> is as ointment <S%H8081><s%> poured <S%H7324><s%> forth, therefore <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> do the virgins <S%H5959><s%> love <S%H157><s%> you.

Draw <S%H4900><s%> me, we will run <S%H7323><s%> after <S%H310><s%> you: the king <S%H4428><s%> has brought <S%H935><s%> me into his chambers: <S%H2315><s%> we will be glad <S%H1523><s%> and rejoice <S%H8055><s%> in you, we will remember <S%H2142><s%> your love <S%H1730><s%> more than wine: <S%H3196><s%> the upright <S%H4339><s%> love <S%H157><s%> you.

I am black, <S%H7838><s%> but comely, <S%H5000><s%> O you daughters <S%H1323><s%> of Jerusalem, <S%H3389><s%> as the tents <S%H168><s%> of Kedar, <S%H6938><s%> as the curtains <S%H3407><s%> of Solomon. <S%H8010><s%>

Look <S%H7200><s%> not on me, because I am black, <S%H7840><s%> because the sun <S%H8121><s%> has looked <S%H7805><s%> on me: my mother's <S%H517><s%> children <S%H1121><s%> were angry <S%H2734><s%> with me; they made <S%H7760><s%> me the keeper <S%H5201><s%> of the vineyards; <S%H3754><s%> but my own vineyard <S%H3754><s%> have I not kept. <S%H5201><s%>

Tell <S%H5046><s%> me, O you whom my soul <S%H5315><s%> loves, <S%H157><s%> where <S%H349><s%> you feed, <S%H7462><s%> where <S%H349><s%> you make your flock to rest <S%H7257><s%> at noon: <S%H6672><s%> for why <S%H4100><s%> should I be as one that turns <S%H5844><s%> aside <S%H5844><s%> by the flocks <S%H5739><s%> of your companions? <S%H2270><s%>

If <S%H518><s%> you know <S%H3045><s%> not, O you fairest <S%H3303><s%> among women, <S%H802><s%> go <S%H3318><s%> your way forth <S%H3318><s%> by the footsteps <S%H6119><s%> of the flock, <S%H6629><s%> and feed <S%H7462><s%> your kids <S%H1423><s%> beside <S%H5921><s%> the shepherds' <S%H7462><s%> tents. <S%H4908><s%>
I have compared <S%H1819><s%> you, O my love, <S%H7474><s%> to a company of horses <S%H5484><s%> in Pharaoh's <S%H6547><s%> chariots. <S%H7393><s%>
Your cheeks <S%H3895><s%> are comely <S%H4998><s%> with rows <S%H8447><s%> of jewels, <S%H3627><s%> your neck <S%H6677><s%> with chains <S%H2737><s%> of gold.
We will make <S%H6213><s%> you borders <S%H8447><s%> of gold <S%H2091><s%> with studs <S%H5351><s%> of silver. <S%H3701><s%>
While <S%H5704><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%> sits at his table, <S%H4524><s%> my spikenard <S%H5373><s%> sends <S%H5414><s%> forth the smell <S%H7381><s%> thereof.
A bundle <S%H6872><s%> of myrrh <S%H4753><s%> is my well-beloved <S%H1730><s%> to me; he shall lie <S%H3885><s%> all <S%H3885><s%> night between <S%H996><s%> my breasts. <S%H7699><s%>
My beloved <S%H1730><s%> is to me as a cluster <S%H811><s%> of camphire <S%H3724><s%> in the vineyards <S%H3754><s%> of Engedi. <S%H5872><s%>
Behold, <S%H2009><s%> you are fair, <S%H3302><s%> my love; <S%H7474><s%> behold, <S%H2009><s%> you are fair; <S%H3302><s%> you have doves' <S%H3123><s%> eyes. <S%H5869><s%>
Behold, <S%H2009><s%> you are fair, <S%H3302><s%> my beloved, <S%H157><s%> yes, <S%H637><s%> pleasant: <S%H5273><s%> also <S%H637><s%> our bed <S%H6210><s%> is green. <S%H7488><s%>
The beams <S%H6982><s%> of our house <S%H1004><s%> are cedar, <S%H730><s%> and our rafters <S%H7351><s%> of fir. <S%H1266><s%>
